com.compsci408.rxcore

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.compsci408.rxcore.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    AndroidRx application controller. Contains all intermediary functionality between views and data models.
    Author:
    Evan

      • getDayFromDate

        public static int getDayFromDate(java.lang.String dateString)
        Given a date formatted as a string ('YYYY-MM-dd'), return the integer value of the day of the week on which this date falls.
        Parameters:
        dateString - String of date whose day is to be determined
        Returns:
        Integer [1-7] representing the day of the week.

      • showProgress

                         boolean show)
        Show/hide a ProgressDialog
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be shown
        show - True if should be shown, false otherwise

      • showProgress

        public void showProgress(boolean show)
        Same as showProgress(String, boolean), but without a message
        Parameters:
        show - True if should be shown, false otherwise.

      • checkLogin

        public int checkLogin()
        Check to see if device is already logged in
        Returns:
        Integer value corresponding to AccountType from last login, or -1 if not logged in

      • createAccount

        public void createAccount(java.lang.String username,
                          java.lang.String password,
                          java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String accountType,
                          OnLoginAttemptedListener listener)
        Create a new account with the given credentials
        Parameters:
        username - Username of new account
        password - Password of new account
        name - Name of account holder
        accountType - Type of account (patient or provider)
        listener - Listener indicating appropriate UI updates after web request completes

      • logIn

        public void logIn(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  java.lang.String accountType,
                  OnLoginAttemptedListener listener)
        Log user with given username and password into the system.
        Parameters:
        username - Username entered by user
        password - Password entered by user
        accountType - Account type selected (patient or provider)
        listener - Listener indicating appropriate UI updates after web request completes

      • logOut

        public void logOut()
        Log user out of system
        Parameters:
        username - Username entered by user

      • addPrescriptions

                             OnPrescriptionAddedListener listener)
        Add new Prescriptions to the database
        Parameters:
        prescription - Prescription to be added
        listener - Listener describing UI updates after request is executed

      • addSchedules

        public void addSchedules(java.util.List<Schedule> schedules,
                         OnScheduleAddedListener listener)
        Add new Schedules to the database
        Parameters:
        schedules - Schedules to be added
        listener - Listener describing UI updates after request is executed

      • updatePatients

        public void updatePatients(java.util.List<Patient> patients,
                           OnDataUpdatedListener listener)
        Update information for a list of patients. Useful in changing a patient's associated provider, password, name, etc.
        Parameters:
        patients - List of updated patients
        listener - Listener indicating appropriate UI updates after web request completes

      • updatePrescriptions

        public void updatePrescriptions(java.util.List<Prescription> prescriptions,
                                OnDataUpdatedListener listener)
        Update information for a list of prescriptions. Used particularly for marking prescriptions as 'set' once an associated schedule (with an actual time) has been set
        Parameters:
        patients - List of updated prescriptions
        listener - Listener indicating appropriate UI updates after web request completes

      • getPatientsForProvider

        public void getPatientsForProvider(OnPatientsLoadedListener listener)
        Get all of the patients associated with the currently logged in provider.

      • filterMedicationsByName

        public void filterMedicationsByName(java.lang.String input,
                                    OnMedicationsLoadedListener listener)
        Filter all of the medications by an input string. Used for autocomplete functionality.
        Parameters:
        input - Text entered by user
        listener - Listener describing UI updates after request is executed

      • getMedicationByName

        public void getMedicationByName(OnMedInfoLoadedListener listener)
        Get general information for the selected medication and update the UI as indicated by the provided listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener which describes UI updates upon successful web request.

      • getPrescriptionsForPatient

        public void getPrescriptionsForPatient(OnPrescriptionLoadedListener listener)
        Get all of the prescriptions associated with the current patient.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener describing UI updates after request is executed

      • startCamera

        public void startCamera(SurfaceHolder preview)
        Start the device's camera, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        preview - SurfaceHolder on which the camera's preview is to be rendered.

      • takePicture

        public void takePicture(SurfaceHolder preview,
                        boolean upload,
                        OnPictureTakenListener callback)
        Take a picture using the device's camera
        Parameters:
        upload - Boolean indicating whether the image should be uploaded. If false, save image locally.

      • loadImage

        public static Bitmap loadImage(java.lang.String name,
                               Context context)
        Load an image from the device's memory
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the file to be loaded (in this case, it is the name of the associated medication)
        context - Context of the application
        Returns:
        Bitmap representation of the image to be loaded.
